Dear expert crawlers,

I keep receiving warnings like the following in the heritrix_out.log file:

java.io.IOException: Too many open files

Moreover, after half hour or so, typically crawling becomes very slow,
which I suspect is related to the above warning.

I saw in the faqs that this is a common problem, that can be solved by 
increasing the heritrix file descriptor limit in 

/etc/security/limits.conf

Which I did:

@heritrix     hard    nofile  32768

(I have a user heritrix belonging to the group heritrix.)

Now, since I keep having the same problems (warnings and crawling becoming
very slow), I am planning to further increase that limit. Is there any
counter-indication to use a really huge value as file descriptor number
upper bound?

Also, is it reasonable to think that the slowness of the crawl is due to 
this problem, or the crawl being very slow is not the typical symptom of 
problems with the number of file descriptors?

Thanks a lot and a happy 2005 to everybody!

Regards,

Marco
